Legal_Issue: Does the exclusion of a homosexual partner from the Private Family Visiting Program violate Section 15 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms?
Governing_Law: Section 15 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Decision_Outcome: The exclusion violates Section 15 of the Charter
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate discrimination
Legal_Rule: Section 15 prohibits discrimination based on enumerated or analogous grounds; sexual orientation is an analogous ground
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on context
Procedural_Issue: Denial of grievance based on discriminatory policy
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Policy applied unfairly due to discriminatory exclusion
Key_Evidence_Considered: Exclusion of same-sex partners under the visiting program policy
Legal_Framework: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms, human rights legislation
Applicant_Challenge: Exclusion from visiting program based on sexual orientation
Court_Result: Ordered reconsideration of the grievance in line with Section 15
Legal_Rule_Source: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Defendant_Response: Relied on policy restricting visits to heterosexual common-law partners
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 15 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Governing_Rule: Section 15 of the Charter prohibits discrimination on analogous grounds including sexual orientation
